1.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
1.str2: To give solemn evidence, testify (declare) solemnly. From dia and martureo; to attest or protest earnestly, or hortatively.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

1.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
1.str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

1.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
1.str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
1.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Appearing, manifestation, glorious display. From epiphanes; a manifestation, i.e. the advent of Christ.

1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
1.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
2.str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
2.str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.
Opportunely, in season, conveniently. Adverb from eukairos; opportunely.
Unseasonably, out of due season, inopportunely. Adverb from the same as akaireomai; inopportunely.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
2.str2: (a) I reprove, rebuke, discipline, (b) I expose, show to be guilty. Of uncertain affinity; to confute, admonish.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
2.str2: From epi and timao; to tax upon, i.e. Censure or admonish; by implication, forbid.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
2.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Patience, forbearance, longsuffering. From the same as makrothumos; longanimity, i.e. forbearance or fortitude.
Teaching, doctrine, what is taught. From didasko; instruction.

3.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

3.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

3.str2: To endure, bear with, have patience with, suffer, admit, persist.

18.str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From epi and ouranos; above the sky.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.

18.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
18.str2: Who, which, what, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

19.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
19.str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
Of Latin origin; feminine of Priscus, ancient; Priska, a Christian woman.
Probably for Latin aquila; Akulas, an Israelite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
From a derivative of oninemi and phoros; profit-bearer; Onesiphorus, a Christian.

20.str2: Erastus, steward of Corinth, a Christian. From erao; beloved; Erastus, a Christian.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Trophimus, a Christian of Ephesus in Asia. From trophe; nutritive; Trophimus, a Christian.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: From apo and leipo; to leave behind; by implication, to forsake.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
20.str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Miletus, a city on the coast of the Roman province Asia. Of uncertain origin; Miletus, a city of Asia Minor.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
21.str2: To hasten, be eager, be zealous. From spoude; to use speed, i.e. To make effort, be prompt or earnest.
A primary preposition; 'fore', i.e. In front of, prior to.
From a derivative of cheo, meaning a storm; by implication, the rainy season, i.e. Winter.
Eubulus, a Christian with Paul in Rome. From eu and boulomai; good-willer; Eubulus, a Christian.

21.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
Pudens, a Christian man in Rome. Of Latin origin; modest; Pudes, a Christian.
Linus, a Christian in Rome. Perhaps from linon; Linus, a Christian.
Feminine of Klaudios; Claudia, a Christian woman.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

22.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

22.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
22.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

22.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
22.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
